safety.title: Triple-Layer Safety Architecture

layer1.title: Risk Budget Guard
layer1.description: Pre-execution constraints that prevent unsafe changes before any file writes
layer1.feature1: Max 10 files per cycle (configurable in gates.yml)

layer2.title: Undo Snapshots

layer3.title: Attestation Chain

trust.title: ML-Powered Trust Scoring
trust.subtitle: Every recipe earns a trust score (0.1-1.0) based on historical success rates, with automatic blacklisting after 3 consecutive failures

feature1.title: Dynamic Trust Adjustment
feature1.description: Trust = max(0.1, min(1, success_count / run_count)) updated after every cycle

feature2.title: Recipe Blacklisting
feature2.description: Recipes with trust < 0.2 automatically excluded from execution

feature3.title: Historical Analytics
feature3.description: Complete run history in .odavl/history.json with timestamps and outcomes

ml-trust-scoring.title: How ML Trust Scoring Powers ODAVL Autopilot
ml-trust-scoring.excerpt: Deep dive into the TensorFlow.js-based trust scoring system that enables safe autonomous code improvements with 92%+ accuracy.
ml-trust-scoring.content:
ODAVL Autopilot uses a sophisticated machine learning system to predict the success probability of each improvement recipe before execution. This trust scoring mechanism is the key to safe autonomous operation.

The system trains on historical execution data, analyzing factors like code complexity, error patterns, and repository structure to build a predictive model. Each recipe maintains a running trust score between 0.1 and 1.0, updated after every execution.

Our TensorFlow.js model achieves 92% accuracy in predicting recipe success, with validation loss below 0.15. This allows Autopilot to confidently select the best action while avoiding risky changes.

The trust scoring system includes three safety layers: initial trust threshold (0.5), consecutive failure blacklisting (3 failures), and adaptive learning that penalizes repeated mistakes. This creates a self-improving system that gets safer over time.

In production environments, recipes that consistently succeed see their trust scores rise to 0.9+, while problematic recipes quickly drop below the execution threshold. This dynamic scoring ensures maximum safety without manual intervention.
ml-trust-scoring.takeaways:
Trust scores range from 0.1 to 1.0, updated after each execution
TensorFlow.js model achieves 92% prediction accuracy
Recipes with 3 consecutive failures are automatically blacklisted
System self-improves through continuous learning
Production-proven with 2.4M+ automated fixes

wcag-compliance.title: Achieving WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance with ODAVL Guardian
wcag-compliance.excerpt: Complete guide to automated accessibility testing, from ARIA validation to keyboard navigation checks, helping teams meet regulatory requirements.
wcag-compliance.content:
Web accessibility is not optionalâ€”it's a legal requirement in many jurisdictions and a moral imperative for inclusive design. ODAVL Guardian automates WCAG 2.1 compliance testing to help teams meet AA and AAA standards.

Our accessibility testing engine validates four key principles: Perceivable (text alternatives, time-based media), Operable (keyboard access, seizure prevention), Understandable (readable content, predictable behavior), and Robust (parser compatibility, assistive technology support).

Guardian performs 120+ automated checks covering color contrast ratios (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text), ARIA attributes, heading hierarchy, form labels, focus indicators, and semantic HTML structure. It integrates with axe-core and Lighthouse for comprehensive validation.

For teams facing regulatory deadlines, Guardian provides actionable reports with specific remediation steps. Each issue includes severity level, WCAG criterion reference, code location, and fix examples. This accelerates compliance from months to weeks.

Our customers have achieved 100% WCAG AA compliance using Guardian's automated testing in CI/CD pipelines, catching accessibility issues before they reach production.
wcag-compliance.takeaways:
WCAG 2.1 has three levels: A (essential), AA (recommended), AAA (enhanced)
Guardian performs 120+ automated accessibility checks
Integrates with axe-core and Lighthouse for comprehensive coverage
Provides actionable reports with specific remediation steps
91% average accessibility improvement across customer base

python-support.title: Announcing Python Support: Multi-Language Code Quality
python-support.excerpt: ODAVL Insight now supports Python with specialized detectors for type hints, PEP compliance, security vulnerabilities, and complexity analysis.
python-support.content:
We're excited to announce full Python support in ODAVL Insight, expanding our multi-language code quality platform. This release includes five specialized detectors for Python codebases.

The Python Type Detector validates type hints using mypy integration, ensuring type safety in modern Python projects. It catches common issues like missing annotations, incorrect return types, and incompatible type usage.

Our PEP Compliance Detector enforces PEP 8 style guidelines, PEP 257 docstring conventions, and PEP 484 type hints. It integrates with flake8 and black for consistent code formatting across teams.

The Security Detector identifies SQL injection vulnerabilities, XSS risks, insecure deserialization, hardcoded secrets, and unsafe eval() usage. It uses bandit for static security analysis and provides actionable remediation guidance.

Complexity analysis includes cyclomatic complexity (McCabe), cognitive complexity, and maintainability index calculations. The detector flags functions exceeding thresholds and suggests refactoring opportunities.

Python support is available today in ODAVL Insight Cloud, CLI, and VS Code extension. Existing customers can enable Python detection with zero configuration.
python-support.takeaways:
Five specialized detectors: Type, PEP, Security, Complexity, Import
Integrates with mypy, flake8, black, and bandit
Detects SQL injection, XSS, and insecure deserialization
Provides actionable remediation guidance
Available in Cloud, CLI, and VS Code extension

ci-cd-integration.title: Guardian CI/CD Integration Best Practices
ci-cd-integration.excerpt: Learn how to integrate ODAVL Guardian into GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and Jenkins for automated pre-deploy quality gates.
ci-cd-integration.content:
Integrating ODAVL Guardian into CI/CD pipelines ensures quality gates are enforced before every deployment. This guide covers best practices for GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and Jenkins integration.

For GitHub Actions, use the official ODAVL Guardian action with quality thresholds, fail conditions, and artifact uploads. Configure parallel jobs for faster feedback and use matrix strategies for multi-environment testing.

GitLab CI integration leverages Docker containers for consistent execution. Store Guardian results as artifacts and use GitLab's merge request approvals to block deployments failing quality gates.

Jenkins integration uses the ODAVL CLI in pipeline scripts. Configure post-build actions to publish Guardian reports and trigger notifications on quality gate failures.

Key configuration tips: Set appropriate thresholds (accessibility: 95%, security: 98%, performance: 85%), use caching to speed up repeated runs, and configure notifications to alert teams of regressions.

With CI/CD integration, teams catch issues early, reduce deployment risks, and maintain consistent quality standards across all environments.
ci-cd-integration.takeaways:
Integrate Guardian into GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and Jenkins
Set quality thresholds: accessibility 95%, security 98%, performance 85%
Use caching for faster CI/CD runs
Configure notifications for quality gate failures
Block deployments that fail quality checks

security-detection.title: Advanced Security Detection: From OWASP Top 10 to Zero-Day Prevention
security-detection.excerpt: Explore ODAVL Insight's security detection capabilities, including OWASP Top 10 coverage, CVE scanning, and proactive vulnerability prevention.
security-detection.content:
Security is paramount in modern software development. ODAVL Insight provides multi-layered security detection covering OWASP Top 10, CVE scanning, and proactive vulnerability prevention.

Our Security Detector identifies SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, insecure deserialization, broken authentication, sensitive data exposure, XML external entities, broken access control, security misconfiguration, and insufficient logging.

CVE scanning integrates with the National Vulnerability Database to detect known vulnerabilities in dependencies. It provides remediation guidance including version upgrades, patches, and workarounds.

Proactive detection uses pattern matching and heuristic analysis to identify potential zero-day vulnerabilities before they're exploited. This includes detecting insecure random number generation, weak cryptography, and race conditions.

Security reports include severity ratings (Critical, High, Medium, Low), CVE references, exploit likelihood, and remediation priority. Integration with GitHub Security Advisories ensures teams stay informed of new threats.

ODAVL customers have achieved 98% security scores and zero security incidents in production through continuous security monitoring.
security-detection.takeaways:
Covers OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities comprehensively
Integrates with National Vulnerability Database for CVE scanning
Proactive detection for potential zero-day vulnerabilities
Provides severity ratings and remediation priority
98% average security score across customer base

monorepo-patterns.title: Monorepo Quality Patterns: Scaling ODAVL Across 150+ Microservices
monorepo-patterns.excerpt: Best practices for applying ODAVL Studio to monorepo architectures, from workspace-level policies to service-specific quality gates.
monorepo-patterns.content:
Monorepos present unique quality challenges at scale. This guide covers proven patterns for applying ODAVL Studio to monorepo architectures with 150+ microservices.

Workspace-level policies define baseline quality standards across all services. Use .odavl/gates.yml at the monorepo root to set global constraints: max file changes, protected paths, and quality thresholds.

Service-specific overrides allow teams to customize quality gates for individual services. Each service can have its own .odavl/gates.yml with stricter or relaxed constraints based on criticality.

Shared configurations eliminate duplication through inheritance. Define common detector settings, recipe libraries, and trust score policies once, then reference them across services.

Incremental analysis optimizes performance by only analyzing changed files. ODAVL Insight detects affected services using dependency graphs and runs targeted analysis instead of full workspace scans.

Cross-service quality metrics aggregate data across the monorepo, providing executive dashboards showing overall health, error trends, and team performance.

Implementing these patterns, TechCorp Global reduced quality gate execution time by 73% while maintaining comprehensive coverage across their entire monorepo.
monorepo-patterns.takeaways:
Define workspace-level policies for baseline standards
Use service-specific overrides for critical services
Shared configurations eliminate duplication
Incremental analysis targets only changed services
Aggregate metrics provide executive-level visibility

response.question: How quickly will I receive a response?
response.answer: We typically respond to all inquiries within 24 hours during business days. For urgent technical support issues, Enterprise customers receive priority response within 4 hours.

demo.question: Can I schedule a product demo?
demo.answer: Absolutely! Contact our sales team at sales@odavl.studio to schedule a personalized demo. We'll walk you through all three products and answer your specific questions.

pricing.question: Do you offer custom pricing for large teams?
pricing.answer: Yes! Our Enterprise plan includes custom pricing based on your team size, usage needs, and deployment requirements. Contact enterprise@odavl.studio for a quote.

trial.question: Is there a free trial available?
trial.answer: Yes! All new users get a 14-day free trial of our Professional plan with full access to all features. No credit card required to start.

support-hours.question: What are your support hours?
support-hours.answer: Our standard support hours are 9 AM - 6 PM in your local timezone (SF, London, Singapore). Enterprise customers receive 24/7 support with guaranteed SLAs.

custom.question: Can you build custom integrations?
custom.answer: Yes! Our Enterprise plan includes custom integration development. We can build connectors for your internal tools, CI/CD pipelines, or proprietary systems.

recipes.title: Recipe System

safety.title: Safety Mechanisms
safety.description: Risk Budget Guard: max 10 files, 40 LOC per cycle. Protected paths enforcement via gates.yml

undo.title: Undo Snapshots
undo.description: Timestamped file backups in .odavl/undo/ with latest.json symlink for instant rollback

trust.title: Trust Scoring
trust.description: ML feedback loop updates recipe trust based on success/failure. Blacklists after 3 failures

attestation.title: Attestation Chain
attestation.description: SHA-256 cryptographic proofs of improvements in .odavl/attestation/ for audit compliance

guardian.description: Pre-deploy testing dashboard with accessibility, performance, and security validation

accessibility.description: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance with axe-core integration. 120+ automated checks for screen readers and keyboard navigation

performance.title: Performance Monitoring
performance.description: Core Web Vitals: LCP, FID, CLS. Lighthouse integration with TTFB, resource size, and render analysis

security.title: Security Scanning
security.description: OWASP Top 10 detection, CSP validation, SSL/TLS checks, CVE scanning with NVD integration

cicd.title: CI/CD Integration
cicd.description: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins support. Quality gates with configurable thresholds (95%/98%/85%)

monitoring.title: Real-Time Monitoring
monitoring.description: Multi-environment support (staging, production). Historical trend analysis and regression detection

alerts.title: Smart Alerts
alerts.description: Webhook integration for Slack, Teams, email. Configurable severity levels and notification rules
